intro: Mormolyca fumea, commonly known as the smoky mormolyca, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its pale, smoky-colored flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a unique visual element to its natural habitat. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and requires a cool, moist environment to thrive. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh climate. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Mormolyca fumea is considered a species of conservation concern.
